h1: Negative Exposure Assessment (NEA) Software for OSHA Compliance
heroCopy: Generate defensible NEAs using verified exposure data and standardized documentation workflows.
painPoints: Manual NEA generation and formatting delays closeout and increases risk.
Historical exposure comparison is difficult in disconnected systems.
NEAs are often challenged when sampling context and controls are not documented consistently.
workflow: Generate NEAs from structured survey and monitoring data.
Compare historical exposure patterns to improve defensibility.
Build NEAs from verified sampling data with task descriptions, controls, and methods tied to each result.
Automate TWA calculations and threshold comparisons with clear determinations and validity conditions.
Generate client-ready NEAs with attachments lists (lab reports, COC, photos) and revision history.
regulatoryReferences: EPA evidence retention expectations for environmental projects.
NESHAP-relevant references for asbestos-related reporting contexts.
featureBreakdown: Attachment and evidence linkage (lab reports, COC, photos)
Defensible NEA narrative generation from source data

faqs.question: Can AbateIQ speed up NEA reporting?
faqs.answer: Yes. Structured workflows reduce manual assembly and improve report consistency.

faqs.question: How does AbateIQ improve NEA defensibility?
faqs.answer: It links report outputs to underlying exposure and field evidence for audit-ready documentation.

faqs.question: Why are NEAs rejected or challenged?
faqs.answer: NEAs are challenged when sampling data is incomplete, tasks and controls are unclear, or results aren’t traceable to lab reports. AbateIQ ties NEAs directly to verified source data.

faqs.question: Does AbateIQ include validity conditions in NEAs?
faqs.answer: Yes. NEAs can include conditions required for validity (same materials, controls, work practices) and guidance on when re-evaluation is needed.
